title: Kinematics - Change in velocity from graphs

content.question: Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="delta v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta v sub 1 is greater than delta v sub 2, which is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta v sub 1 is greater than open parenthesis, delta v sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Open parenthesis, delta v sub 1 equals delta v sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta v sub 1 equals delta v sub 2, which equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta v sub 1 is greater than open parenthesis, delta v sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
